attributes.action: To install speed calming measures around the Sparrows Lane area of New Eltham
attributes.additional_details:
I would like there to be speed humps because sadly last year my cat was hit by a speeding car causing her to be put down. I can not imagine if this was a child.  The amount of distraught there would be to the family would be tremendous.

There should be speed humps because there is 2 local nurseries and an entrance to Avery Hill Park. There is also Charlton Athletic Training Ground and all this means lots of cars some speeding.  This is one of the busiest roads in New Eltham without speed bumps.
attributes.background: I would like the government to install speed humps or other techniques of slowing down cars around the Sparrows Lane area of New Eltham so the risk of harm to people and animals can be minimised.

rejection.details:
We're very sorry to hear about what happened to your cat.

We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You can find some information about requesting speed control measures in Greenwich here: https://www.royalgreenwich.gov.uk/info/200264/road_safety/89/speed_control 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
